Reviews.Title: Take the time to tweak it
Reviews.Author: tourists
Reviews.Content: As of this writing, we've owned the 46-inch version of this set for exactly 5 months and have used it continuously for a few hours almost every day.Although I've given it a 5-star rating, on an absolute scale, the picture quality is probably a 4 or 4.5, mainly because I've seen a Panasonic plasma GT50 series set with an arguably more accurate picture. However, the latter wasn't available in 46-inches (the largest size we could accommodate) and the presentation was too analytical to enjoy watching. By that I mean, on newscasts, live studio presentations, and the like, you could easily see how the total image was composited from various sources (which I found to be distracting), while the Samsung presented everything as a seamless whole.In reading over past reviews of the Samsung LED models, you'll notice random criticism of uneven tones, especially during dark or black scenes, as well as "flashlighting" -- the appearance of light shining from the corners during dark or black scenes. We've experienced absolutely none of these. Either the quality control has improved or there have been design upgrades or we've been lucky. Most of those complaints seem to date from 2009, so hopefully the absence of these issues was more than luck.Regarding color, with a cable set-top box (STB) the set was quite viewable out of the box at the factory defaults. However, it still benefited from following the c|net recommendations reprinted in other reviews. A major caveat, though, is that every input source has to be independently adjusted and then tweaked even further.For example, while the c|net settings were pretty close for the STB, the contrast was way off for a pair of DVD players (a Toshiba and a Denon) and our PVR (a homemade Tivo, based on a PC) also needed it's own settings that differed from the others. Ditto for a vintage Pioneer LaserDisc player. It helped to have a set of Red, Blue, and Green filters from the Video Essentials DVD to optimize the color and contrast. The set's built-in test patterns were also useful. Take nothing for granted -- you really need to experiment to get the right settings. There are literally dozens of menus and sub-menus that give you a an amazing (and confusing) amount of control over the image quality. Get them wrong and you'll wonder what all the fuss is about. Get them right and you'll marvel at the superb quality of this picture.Speaking of of image quality, DVD and HD cable channels are clearly the best sources. The lower channels (2-128) really suffer, as do non-HD PVR recordings and, surprisingly, LaserDiscs. We don't have a Blu-ray player, but expect the quality will be high with that, as well.Further thoughts -- It only took 20 minutes to unpack, assemble, and start watching. The first thing I did was to upgrade the firmware via our home network. Every room is hardwired with RJ-45 outlets and the upgrade went smoothly. However, I've been warned that future firmware updates will wipe out all custom settings, so be sure to keep a log of every input adjustment you make.My only real pet peeve is the inability to put your own remote control labels on each input source. There are a hand full of default names to choose from, but LaserDisc Player (among others), is not one of them. Otherwise, the remote and menu are among the best I've ever used.Beyond that, as many people have commented, the visual presentation, in which the picture seems to float in mid-air, is a big plus. We've never liked sets that have wide bezels and, considering what a visual element a wide screen TV is in any room, it was worth spending the extra money to get a set with a minimal border and clear supporting pillar.To sum it up, when properly tweaked, this set really gets out of the way and allows you to enjoy your movie or show without feeling distracted by the equipment.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV from all angles!
Reviews.Author: MJ
Reviews.Content: Review is after 2 weeks of use, approxmiately 4 hours a day, utilizing HD-Cable service, bluray, and Hulu+ via the TV's SmartHub.Pros:+ Amazing picture and brightness.  The first test I ran this through was the first 20 minutes of Casino Royale bluray, as it would test all the colors and motion.  One word to sum it up would be "stunning" -- as my old man put it "I never realized just how blue Daniel Craig's eyes were..."  (He then proceeded to demand the model # of the TV so he could order it.+ Nigh-bezeless display - Its hard to explain why this is important, other than that certain je ne sais qois of not having one. It gives the tv a 2500$ luxury feel despite being much less.+ Inputs inputs inputs!  I am utilizing a mini display-to-HDMI, sound-bar HDMI, bluray HDMI, cable HDMI and still probably have some to spare!  There are even two USBs.  Not sure why you would need this but still pretty neat.Cons:- Kind of have to stretch this since there aren't any glaring weaknesses, but I wish all these SmartHub TVs came with a QWERTY remote because searching for stuff on Youtube and Hulu can be a pain with the d-pad and enter button.- SmartHub could be a little snappier.  I suppose given this is all cloud computing its to be expected that the response can drag a bit, especially when loading apps.  Still, I can dream right?

Reviews.Title: Another Great Samsung
Reviews.Author: KC
Reviews.Content: This is our second Samsung TV purchased from Amazon. Samsung keeps making their products better and cheaper, which is the curse of the electrical engineering business, as confirmed by all of my former students (I am an EE professor). I did not intend to purchase a 3D TV and may never take advantage of this functionality, so this review applies only to 2D. My wife and I like it very much. It is a beautiful design with a clear, bright image that is easy to watch in our sun room with windows on the east, south and west. We were even surprised by the quality of the sound. My only complaint is not a big thing. I ordered this as a surprise Christmas present for my wife. Unfortunately, it was delivered while we were out running a couple of errands and ended up in front of the door of our condo where she saw what it was. It was still a surprise, but I had an elaborate scheme worked out where we would use it to Skype with one of our daughters so we could open presents together. This was the first year our daughter was not able to join us for Christmas. Of course our Skype experience also showed that it works well as a computer monitor.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased!
Reviews.Author: R. Tripp
Reviews.Content: I have been a Samsung owner for a number of years and have always enjoyed the quality of construction and design in previous models.  The Samsung 6400 was purchased just in time for Thanksgiving and all I can say is that Samsung did not disappoint.  It has an amazing picture image right out of the box with brilliant colors and excellent contrast even in a well lit room.  What is also remarkable about the TV is how thin it is.  We used the Samsung wall mount system that treats the TV set like hanging a picture.  Surprisingly lightweight and looks terrific mounted on the wall.  Very pleased with the purchase.  My only disappointment is that WiFi is not built into the set but requires the Samsung wireless adapter.  A small price to pay in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Jet
Reviews.Content: We purchased this Samsung TV from Paul's TV via Amazon. It was the best price we could find and the shipping was free, well packed and arrived quickly. We are very pleased with the picture quality and all the features tha TV has available. Would not hesitate to buy from this source again.

Reviews.Title: Amazing product
Reviews.Author: sntennis
Reviews.Content: I really love this TV.  The stand is great, it is light, think, strong, brilliant color.  I would buy it again.  Got a great deal on here as well.

Reviews.Title: So close to being great, if not perfect
Reviews.Author: W. Rivera
Reviews.Content: It was between this model (Samsung UN40D6400) and the LG 42LV5500, which at the time of purchase was similarly priced. I chose this model simply because of the slim .5" all-around bezel; it surely affects your viewing experience (the slimmer the bezel, the better). I absolutely would give the tv five stars if it wasn't for one simple flaw: it does not come with the Amazon Instant Video widget. I prefer to use AIV over Vudu or any of the other included streaming services. I read somewhere on a forum that apparently some models, depending on their manufacturing date, do come with the AIV widget. I contacted Samsung and they informed me that AIV was not compatible with my particular model. It's basically another gimmick by tech companies to force you to buy higher-end models. You'd think that paying almost $1,100 for a television would get you a simple MAJOR streaming service such as Amazon Instant Video. I considered returning the tv, but the return period had ended. The tv is great nonetheless; Samsung not including AIV in this model, from a consumer's point of view and a techie's POV, is blasphemous.

Reviews.Title: Amazing quality/Technology still nascent
Reviews.Author: S. Rajan
Reviews.Content: I have this TV for over a week, I am like a bull in a china shop exploring the features of the TVThe TV HD quality is amazing, I have basic cable with only the basic HD channels, got this TV for accessing content via internet. I had to invest in a Linstick,the Samsung USB adaptor for net access, it is pretty much plug and play but my 802.11g router was not fast enough particularly for 3D channels, had to invest in 802.11n after which access to the SmartHub improved a lot. The apps available in the SmartHub are quite a bit but expect for the movie channels (Vudu, Netfix, Blockbuster, CinemaNow, Huluplus) rest of the content is still ordinary however emerging, with all the reviews I have read Samsung TV apps are ahead of other brands. I intend to use the TV primarily accessing high quality video and streaming content from the web and will not mind paying per view if the content is good, I hope Samsung continues to lead the pack with contentFinally watched the 3D movies with the 3D app- the quality is astounding, the technology is still new and with the active 3D glasses what they are able to achieve is quite good, watched it from 10ft distance, the Grand Canyon and the dinosaur movies- though it was not a IMAX experience it definitely was a decent 3D experience. The sound quality in 3D mode was poor as the audio setting changed to Low 3D but maybe I needed to hook the TV up with additional speakers.The value this TV provides vs. peers has to be the best, if the apps content keep improving this might be the way I will watching all TV/internet content, bye bye 22" screen and sitting in front of the computer!

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this TV
Reviews.Author: L. Hartley
Reviews.Content: Don't buy this TV!This TV had and I stress HAD a beautiful picture and after 19 mos there's no picture.  We went online with Samsung and did some troubleshooting, etc.......no warranty after a year and we are out of luck.So we are hauling it off to be looked at......may not be pretty.

Reviews.Title: Loved this TV until...
Reviews.Author: HyT3kR3dn3ck
Reviews.Content: I got this TV less then 2 years ago and it has been fantastic.  Great picture,  sound and features (love the Internet enabled features but disappointed that you had to buy a wifi adapter for it; that should have been built in).  However at less than 2 years old it broke.  Was watching TV one evening and the picture went blank but sound continued to work. Called Samsung went through some basic troubleshooting questions and they said that they weren't willing to help me because it was outside of the measly 1 year warranty and it would need to be repaired at the cost of 600 - 1000 dollars.  The TV was never mistreated. I'm highly disappointed in Samsung's quality, warranty length (i don't care if that is the average length warranty,  if you have quality products back them up accordingly) and their support.  If you get this TV beware and make sure to get the extended warranty.

Reviews.Title: Samsung tv
Reviews.Author: Hawgman
Reviews.Content: Received the TV on time and in good shape. The picture quality is outstanding straight out of the box. I'll probably tune the contrast settings but will wait for a rainy day when I have nothing else to do. For now, the picture is great.

Reviews.Title: gorgeous picture
Reviews.Author: Ernest J. Lunsford
Reviews.Content: I love this t.v.! The picture is sharp and clear, the colors are true, everything about it is first-rate. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful 60" led HDTV
Reviews.Author: Vladzilla
Reviews.Content: If your couch is 12 feet away from your tv like mine is,  you can't go wrong with this 60" led. Is as thin as my Android phone and has a clear frame which allows your wall color to show through - ultra modern design. I did my research and looked at a ton of tvs in this class. Nothing comes close to the picture quality, and the price is low compared to other tvs of this size and quality. Smart TV is a little quirky but it mostly serves its purpose. All in all its a great buy.

Reviews.Title: Upmost Clarity, But Still has issues
Reviews.Author: J. Veenker
Reviews.Content: The Clarity on this T.V. with HD T.V. Shows, Blu rays, DVD's and Video games, is great. HOWEVER, There are some ghosting issues with the 120hz on, I find it to be minimal, but for a keen eye, can be annoying. With that being said, you can turn down the 120hz or turn it up depending on what you're watching. It works extremely well. The 3D works fairly well actually with the 2d to 3d on my blu ray player doing the conversion, as well as the T.V. generating it on the spot. Playing Battlefield 3 with the 3D, I could tell that it was 3D, but, not to the same level as you see in the movies made for it. Overall, this is one outstanding T.V. The Remote is nice, the stand is nice, My friends can't believe how great my t.v. looks even compared to their new Sony's and other brands.Pros: 2d to 3D for movies works fairly wellClarity, AmazingEasy to use menutouch sensitive buttons in the back that glow on the screenNavigation on smart t.v. easy to useblu rays = awesomeCons:Minor Ghosting with 120hz2D to 3D on Video games- so-so (to be expected)I've owned for appox 5 months now.

Reviews.Title: Best picture I've seen in TVs, 240 Hz works!
Reviews.Author: Paul Mos.
Reviews.Content: Very nice picture, acceptable sound. The initial reason to buy was very narrow screen frame, which allowed us to squeeze the unit into the space we had. "Smart" features are somewhat slow to "boot", but works just fine: Netflix, etc.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful TV
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV after researching LEDs for over a month.  I am very happy with it.  I also bought a Samsung Blu-ray player w/ WiFi at the same time.  We don't have cable so we just use the LED TV for Apple TV  and Blu-ray w/ Hulu+.  The 3D is OK, but I bought it for the thin bezel.There was a setting that I needed to change in order to get some "ghosting" or "lag" to disappear.  The reviews here helped with that.Update:Almost 2 years later and I'm still very happy with this TV.  Use the "Picture Perfect" tutorials from AVForums to help you choose the right settings for your home.  It ships with "showroom floor"-ready settings which aren't ideal for home viewing.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV, Great for gaming, movies, and television!
Reviews.Author: Wayne R. Bruce
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this LED tv.  Did much research on LEDs before purchasing.  The 3D feature was secondary, in fact, at the time of my purchase the non-3D version was more expensive.  I have not used the 3D feature yet so I cannot comment on that.I use this tv for movies/cable/games.  It makes me want to re-watch all the great movies I have already seen but in HD/Blu-ray.  Games look amazingly sharp and clear.  I play many FPS shooters and have yet to see any blurring.  The refresh rate and contrast ratio were the main factors in my purchase.I love the thin bezel.  Makes set extremely attractive, like one big screen window.  I use a 5.1 sound system connected via optical, but the native speakers are very respectable.The viewing angle is not an issue at all with this tv.  Image looks great at all angles.  The screen is glossy, so it will reflect light.Blacks display true, no bluing.  The edge lighting is only noticeable when all lights are out and when watching dark images.  Even then, it's not very noticeable.  In normal lighting conditions it's completely unnoticeable.I have never been disappointed with Samsung monitors/TVs, make quality products.  Completely satisfied with my purchase, would recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: Superb
Reviews.Author: Lenny
Reviews.Content: No problems so far.  Picture quality is excellent, as long as the source is up to it.. my low def analog cable doesn't look especially awesome, but digital sources and HD video do.  The 3D is better than I had expected, in my limited usage of it.  Currently just have 1 PS3 game in 3d, but it's pretty cool.  The built in converter feature is good, not infallible.  Some shows/games work well with it, others not so much.  COnsidering my cable TV quality, I mostly use it for Netflix, Blurays, or connected to the computer for streaming.  I'm using a cheap DVI->HDMI converter and an HDMI cable for this, works fine.

Reviews.Title: Gorgeous picture!
Reviews.Author: Jlange "Music Lover"
Reviews.Content: I've just installed my first HDTV, the Samsung un40d6400; this replaces a 9-year-old Samsung CRT. I chose a Samsung because I and some friends have always had good experience with them. I got this model because it is so good-looking even when the picture is off! That was important, since this TV will not be hidden behind entertainment center doors like the old TV: it will always be 'on display' in my living room. I love the very thin bezel, much nicer than the thick frames on some flatscreens. I debated about a 46" TV, but my living room is small. This 40" TV is perfect. Instructions to assemble the base were clear. The flat base is very wide and seems quite stable; I was worried my cats would knock the TV over, but I don't think they can with this base.When the TV was first connected to my AT&T; U-Verse box, the picture was terrible: it was standard definition. After I upgraded to the HD signal (another ten dollars per month please), the picture was much better but not great. Then I reset the U-Verse box to deliver 1080 instead of 720, and the picture is simply amazing! It is awesome! I now understand what all the fuss about HDTV has been about.As always, Amazon delivered promptly. My only complaint is that the price dropped $50 between when I placed the order and before the TV got delivered. Amazon won't adjust the price on a TV.

Reviews.Title: I'm picky about image quality, and i like this tv a lot
Reviews.Author: Mark Kawakami
Reviews.Content: I ove this television. The image quality is great, I was able to run advanced calibrations on it easily, with lots of room above and below ideal white and black, so I'm not getting any clippied whites or muddled blacks. The TV itself looks great,  super thin, tiny bezel, etc. The viewing angles are very good, 3D works well if you're into that sort of thing. I wish wifi was built in so I wouldn't have to connect to my network over Ethernet (don't feel like springing for the wireless adaptor).My biggest complaints are that the advanced picture options (many of which I have turned off or turned down) aren't described very well, so if you're picky about getting the best possible image and motion quality, it's hard to know what each of the various options actually do without a lot of trial and error. But on the upside, they have an on-screen manual, which is very helpful.

Reviews.Title: Owned for 3 weeks and love it
Reviews.Author: David Breuer
Reviews.Content: I have owned the UN46D6400 for about 3 weeks and love it. The picture is gorgeous, the setup was easy and it plays very well with the Samsung D6500 series Blu-Ray I purchased at the same time. I really like how close the picture comes to the edge of the TV. I am using the TV with basically no changes to the 'out-of-the-box' settings except that I set the AutoMotion to the "Smooth" setting which I love. Some reviewers say they aren't a fan of this setting. I believe that it takes a bit to get used to, but once you start watching the TV this way, you will really like the smooth, 3-d feel and continue watching your TV this way.For the price I paid, I believe this TV is a wonderful value and will make your family and friends pause and open their mouths when they see a high quality blu-ray or other 1080p images. The TV & blu-ray are connected directly with an HDMI. The two devices communicate with the BD-Wise setting that I believe is specific to Samsung. The remotes are basically interchangeable and the Blu-Ray movies look fantastic.The sound is excellent for such a thin TV. I can't find anything mediocre or negative to report. It is quite easy to change the TV's settings and then set them back to the 'out-of-the-box' default if you want to know where the settings once were.Initially, I was going to buy the UN46D6000 instead of this TV because it received many more 5-star ratings on amazon.com. However, once I looked at both of them in the store, I went with the UND6400 TV (only $150 more for a better overall picture and 3-d capability). I can't comment on any 3-d capabilities at this time as I don't own any glasses.In summary, I think this TV deserves more 5-star ratings based on what you get for the money. Happy hunting,

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: Ann Jeffcoat
Reviews.Content: I picked the 46 inch Samsung 3D for two main reasons.  The size worked for me and other Samsung products have been good. The glasses and Hdmi were a bit slow coming but otherwise it was as promised.As usual getting it through Amazon was good.CJ

Reviews.Title: Awesomest TV ever
Reviews.Author: Florin
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for about 2 months now, and I'm very happy with it. Here's a summary of my impressions.Pros:-the TV is very light and thin and the picture quality is excellent-TV can play files from an external hard drive or from a USB flash drive. I'm using a Seagate FreeAgent GoFlex 1TB drive .  This drive only worked in the bottom most USB port marked HDD-supported file formats: mp3, jpeg, and most of the VOB, MPG, MOV, WMV, AVI I tried.  Some codecs are not supported.  Audio tracks are available for VOB files, but subtitle streams are not-there is 1GB of space on the TV for downloading apps-you can connect a camera to one of the USB ports and the TV will play a slideshow of the pictures-after reading the negative reviews about the sound quality, I was surprised how good the sound was-you can download side by side (SBS) 3d videos and 3d stereographs to your USB drive and watch them in 3D.  Just push the 3D button while playing these movies or displaying these photos.  You can experiment with the 3D capabilities of the TV this way, if you're not sure about investing in an Blu-Ray 3D player. There is a 3D explore app that will also play 3D content, but my DSL connection could not handle streaming that content, which need at least a 4 Mbps connection.-the free Netflix app is good and essential if you're already subscriber. However, it has fewer features than the Apple TV or Wii versions-digital tuner is very good and shows all the programming for the available channels-comes with 2 pairs of 3D glasses that you have to request from the Samsung website. It took Samsung about a couple of weeks to mail the glassesTV Cons:-the channel list does not show what programs are playing on each channel unless you've already watched that channel.-whitish corners are noticeable when displaying a dark picture-glare during daylight can be pretty annoying.-once every few days it just reboots itself while you're in the middle of watching something.App Cons:Since apps are just software, it is possible that all the following issues could be fixed with a software update, but I'm not holding my breath. I've only looked at the free apps.-most of the free apps are lame, like the 50 MB screen saver that plays short loops of spinning disco balls and crackling fire places.-most apps take over the TV and you can't do anything else while you're in the app. This is annoying because, for example, you can't stop Netflix, check one of the TV channels, and then jump back into watching Netflix.  You have to start the app again. The one exception is the ESPN Score Center app, which shows game scores on screen while you watch regular TV.-there is no app for the popular Amazon streaming service-often when you try to start Netflix or Pandora, you get this very annoying error:  "Network Interference Occurred. Please try again later", even though the Internet connection is fine.-there are occasional one second blackouts when watching movies in the Netflix app-the Pandora app stops after a couple of songs

Reviews.Title: Overall a great t.v.
Reviews.Author: parot 161
Reviews.Content: I bought this t.v. to replace our 27" crt.  I did a lot of looking before buying.  I've had it a little over a week.  I have not had a chance to try out the 3-D yet.  It is a great "smart t.v." but with a few minor flaws.My Samsung UN46D6400 television is connected to a Samsung BDD6700 Blu-Ray player (excellent!), Amazon Basics high-speed hdmi cable (excellent!), and an ethernet connection to the t.v. (not wireless) at 12 to 20 or so mgb.Pros:Design:  This t.v. looks great in the living room.  I was afraid it would overwhelm the room, but it doesn't.  Glad I went with a 46" instead of a 40".  Love the glossy screen.  Reflections are not a problem and the lack of a matte finish I think enhances colors.Sound quality:  Excellent (for a t.v.).  I was worried that it would sound completely awful (since the t.v. is so thin) and I can not afford an hdmi capable receiver at the moment.  I'm glad I didn't let that keep me from buying the t.v.  Keep in mind, though, that a few reviewers have noted a sound-sync problem when running the t.v. through an external audio unit. I have not done this yet.Picture quality:  The picture quality is excellent (but I have not tried out the 3-D yet).  Blu-rays look great, dvds look great (after adjusting the automotion a bit), high-definition television looks great.  Watching home photos and movies by attaching an external hard drive to the usb port is a lot of fun.  Video quality from our point and shoot 720p camera looks great on this t.v..  This t.v. makes most Youtube videos look better than they look on my laptop.  Picture sizing options are on the remote to maximize video quality depending on the source.  The Wii looks fine on it even at full-screen.  The quality of streaming movies from Netflix varies from very good to excellent, but any fault lies with Netflix, not Samsung.Off-angle viewing:  I've read some professional reviews that note "poor off-angle viewing" quality.  We haven't noticed the picture degrading except at the most extreme of angles.  We think the picture looks great from just about anywhere in the room.Apps (Smart Hub):  Smart Hub has a lot of potential, but it's not totally there yet.  Some apps are outstanding (such as Vudu, Pandora, and Googlemaps).  Other apps (such as Vimeo) definitely feel "half-baked."  The Youtube app on the t.v. stinks.  It automatically loads a video when you start the app.  I can't figure out how to stop it from loading a random video.  If you've got kids in the room random Youtube videos chosen by the app are NOT a good thing.  On the other hand, the Youtube app on my Samsung bdd6700 Blu-Ray player is great.  It does NOT load a random video on start-up.  It just sits there nicely until I search for something or choose to play something.Interface:The t.v. settings menus are well laid out and easy to use.  App interfaces vary, but are generally very good to excellent.Cons:The backlight:  This is an edge-lit led t.v. and has some of the problems that come with that technology.  I have noticed some flashlighting in the bottom left corner of the screen.  It is not there all of the time and it is not bad enough to return the t.v. or mess up the picture.  Most of the time I don't notice it at all.  Also, the backlight has uniformity problems when using some Smart Hub apps such as Youtube.  This uniformity problem does not seem to be there when watching Blu-rays, dvds, or cable television.  In the daytime or in a room with a light on it probably wouldn't be noticed.  If you like to watch Youtube videos in the dark, it will probably drive you bonkers.  This problem only seems to there when using some of the apps.Bottom line:  A great smart t.v. with a ton of capabilities and a great picture for the price.  Sure the "backlight uniformity with some apps problem" is a disappointment, but this t.v. does such a great job with so many different input sources that I'm willing to cut Samsung some slack for that.  Pair this t.v. with the Samsung BDD6700 Blu-Ray player.  They "play well" together.

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the price
Reviews.Author: V "Val477"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV, but due to my personal pickyness I am returning it. The color on this TV is great, and I have no complaints about the outer design it looks very good. They say most people won't notice a difference between 120hz and 240hz, but I guess I am one of those people. I am very sensitive to motion blur and watch sports that are particularly hard to draw for screens, Soccer and hockey. This TV does a wonderful job of smoothing out images on the screen as long as they do not move to much. People talking and some action, great. Fast action or a puck moving, a bit blurry for my taste.Pros:-Design-Color-Thin-Great picture controlsCons:-Rendering fast motion-Small amount of flashlightingI wouldn't stop most people from getting this TV. If you do get it, do yourself a favor and look up the advanced picture settings through cnet or avs forum.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Television, Stingy Samsung
Reviews.Author: D. Hallowell "Davomatic"
Reviews.Content: This television is incredible: Absurdly low profile, lightweight, unobtrusive bezel, brilliant engineering with on-unit buttons and input array. The image is incredibly clear and vibrant, and the sound is astoundingly good for native speakers (best on any set I've seen).The Smart Hub has an attractive operating system, and the potential for the Samsung App store seems to be great, especially with the possibility of 3D apps, but at the moment there is hardly anything in the store, and the website couldn't accept my credit card info because their drop down menu for cities in my state was non-functional (I tried multiple browsers with the same problem).Despite all of these positives, Samsung has still managed to alienate me as a first-time buyer of their products. I've spent what for me is quite a bit of money getting the 3D television and a Samsung 3D blu-ray player, and neither unit came with a single pair of 3D glasses. I understand the benefit to selling the glasses separately for retail, but the sour taste left in the mouth of the consumer is largely what prevents 3D from becoming more widely adopted. Consumers see 3D technology largely as a gimicky way for producers to generate profit with little value (unlike high def which has such a clear advantage over standard def for the extra cost), and companies practicing in this manner will continue to undercut their own goals as they alienate people like me who want to believe in the added value, but feel swindled in the end. I will certainly be telling a lot of my friends about my experience, and I am the first in my group of upper-middle class folks to attempt the upgrade. I am completely dead in the water for a couple months concerning 3D as I have to save up to buy glasses for my family of three, which costs over a third of the television price. There are rumors that Samsung will be lowering their prices on glasses and changing their practice of not including glasses with their units in the very near future, and this will only alienate me further if it proves true, as I will have bought the product in good faith at the wrong time.

Reviews.Title: TV stopped working in 3 months! A new non-reliable product?
Reviews.Author: JJ
Reviews.Content: It stopped working within 3 months! when I power on the tv, I hear a continuous tick, tick sound from the back and no pic display.Called Samsung customer service and it took 1.5weeks for them to showup and told that they need to order the parts, which may take another 2 weeks. This is a new model and it doesn't look to have reliability. I'm going to retun it now than waiting another 2 weeks to get it fixed!

Reviews.Title: Very Satisfied...Thumbs up!!
Reviews.Author: Eric J. Oliver "Eric-n-Bama"
Reviews.Content: I am well pleased with the Samsung UN55D6400.  It is the lower end of the 3D models, and I have not seen the more expensive ones in person, so I can't help on comparing 3D models.I like to watch my friends trip out on the 3D. The images look like they come off of the screen and are right in front of you. It also looks like you could reach out & touch something.I used the Super Saver free ground shipping. The shipper called & scheduled delivery.Again, Very Pleased.

Reviews.Title: Best yet!
Reviews.Author: Allan Johnston "Amazon guy"
Reviews.Content: I have a LN46A650 Samsung that I purchased 2 years ago and thought it was the best ever.  Wrong.  This UN46 is even better.  As far as I am concerned, Samsung has the best tv's out there.  And, I had to contact customer service about something lately.  They were prompt, helpful and knowledgeable.  I see a lot of negative comments about Samsung's customer service and question those who write the comments.

Reviews.Title: very good picture, but......
Reviews.Author: L. Barclay
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV 2 weeks ago, and while the picture quality is very good, I've noticed that it quickly declines as one moves from directly in front of the set toward either side.  Just move three feet off of center while seated about nine feet from the screen, and the picture is noticeably faded.  I have another Samsung LCD (LN52A650) which I purchased in 2008 which is an LCD model (before LEDs became common), and it does not display this characteristic.  I would give that model a definite 5-star rating.  I wonder if this is characteristic of LED TVs.

Reviews.Title: Review for SAMSUNG UN40D6420
Reviews.Author: tyinatl2011
Reviews.Content: After much contemplation, pulled the trigger on this unit (UN40D6420).  First one I brought home from BestBuy had a bad pixel.  After using this TV extensively for a month I am somewhat pleased.  I do see some some graininess in motion scenes.  Sound is OK, but speakers face the rear.  There is a LOT of customization required to get the full use out of this set.  It does however, offer many options.  I can't imagine anyone like my elderly father using this set to anywhere near its potential.  I am constantly adjusting the picture, sound, etc. when viewing diff. things.  The 3D is somewhat impressive looking at the 3D Channels on Direct TV.  I bought this unit for an antique cabinet in a family vacation home, sure wish I could have fit the 46' in there...  The glossy screen DOES reflect all the lamps in the room, effecting what you are going to have on when trying to watch TV.  It is my understanding that now most bright leds, like and including the samung will have a glossy led screen.  Not to sure about the factory settings, as I said diff. content looks better with diff. settings.  Possibly check CNET for calibrating options.Pay the extra money and get the 46'.  I would have love to have waited for the new 40' model with 240MHZ to come out and would have gladly paid the difference.  The 3D glasses that I received for free seem a little fragile, they are also somewhat hard to turn on and off.Overall I have enjoyed this TV, but I do think it is overpriced.

Reviews.Title: The screen is black; not covered under warranty
Reviews.Author: Laurie
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV just 2years and 8 months ago.  I especially liked how thin and light the TV was.  Initially, lots of good things to say.  However, just like all the others here, I was watching the TV, I got a double image for about one minute and then it went black.I called Samsung and jumped through their hurdles; they finally told me it had to go to a repair center and it's not under their unforgivable one year warranty.  What, I paid $1400 for a TV 2+ years ago and it doesn't work!Samsung stated they were not aware of this TV model having any issues (I guess they have not seen the reviews here).  Also, if you google Samsung TV, you will see other models have problems with the capacitors (something like that).When I go to the Samsung site, the nearest service center states it's 84 miles away.  Well, I plug the address into mapquest and it's over 150 miles away.  So, what, I have to drive 150 miles to hear it's going to cost me some unknown amount of money.  I am concerned when I read online where people are gouged at these service centers because there are so few of them.So, for now, I will pull my little 20 year old 13" Sony out of storage while I figure out what I want to do with this 46" piece of junk.

Reviews.Title: Excellent picture, but did have a "blowout"
Reviews.Author: Lee Tyler
Reviews.Content: Great picture, but after about 18 months, had a big "pop", and unit was dead.  However, I blamed myself for not having the TV on a surge protector.  And I have several other Sammy HDTVs, some as old as 7-8 years (most, but not all, on surge-protectors), and they are all running perfectly.  Being a DIY type of person, did research, bought a new main board ($100), popped it in, and all is well...of course, on a surge-protector this time...after a year, still working perfectly.  Only give a 4-star in case the known "bad capacitor" issue of which Samsung settled a couple of years back, and perhaps what really happened.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, but back light died out on it fast.
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: Great tv, the only bad thing is that the back light on it died very fast after getting it. Besides that, this TV is amazing.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV
Reviews.Author: AdamsBQ06
Reviews.Content: Great Features, Great Picture.  Great Quality.  I bought this TV as an upgrade to an older Samsung DLP.  I love it.  It is great in all lighting situations.

Reviews.Title: AAA+++ Excellent
Reviews.Author: Robert S. Trenholm "RSTFamily"
Reviews.Content: Owned for 2 years now...excellent, no problems.Picture is the sharpest then any other TV I have come across to date, Smart function is the best...kiss expensive Cable good bye.  Several Automatic Updates to software/hardware already, no problems.I recommend to my friends!

Reviews.Title: Best TV ever made!
Reviews.Author: Ryan K Locke
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV at Sears in 2011. Someone broke into my house and stole it in 2012. I went back to the store to replace it with my insurance money and they were no longer being made. So I bought the Samsung similar to this one (only it was brand new) and immediately I was angry. Samsung replaced this model with a much sleeker looking model but the image on the screen was not as clear or bright as the old one, the features were annoying (such as beeping every time you turn the volume up or down), and they got rid of the outputs for older electronic components (such as RCA video components). Even the people at the store told me that Samsung electronic products made in 2011 work and operate much better than the newer products. I wont mention any names or stores (because I visited so many), but they all agreed that if I wanted my old one, you'd have to order it.So, when I couldn't find this TV anywhere, I got on Amazon.com and found a seller. I immediately bought it and have been using it every day I've had it! Great television and anyone who says otherwise is just trying to sell you something new; not better!

Reviews.Title: Una Imagen excelente para ser un TV de Gama Media
Reviews.Author: Elvis Jesus Luzardo Quero
Reviews.Content: Was looking for a Samsung Tv To integrate it into my ps3 and this was perfect. Very good image and design, in sound is not very good, but acceptable for the price. I recommend

Reviews.Title: good picture
Reviews.Author: sb
Reviews.Content: i have owned this for over a year now.  i had to replace the screen (under warranty) at about 11 months. i have 2 other samsungs and never had an issue. the customer service showed up in about 2 days and replace it.

Reviews.Title: Nice Television
Reviews.Author: JME
Reviews.Content: Extremely low power consumption. Great picture. Minimal motion artifacts and good viewing angle for an LCD television. Network ready. I like this very thin television.

Reviews.Title: Best picture goes to . . .  .
Reviews.Author: P.Gallagher, 50s Housewife "Pam Gallagher"
Reviews.Content: This TV is AMAZING.  It feels like you are in a movie theater whether you are watching a movie, TV show or a commercial!  Are you sure you need the 3D glasses?

Reviews.Title: I love this tv
Reviews.Author: Christopher de la Paz
Reviews.Content: It's perfect. 3d is nice. Clear as can be picture. Sleek design with almost no border. Looks great mounted on the wall. Highly recommend this tv but don't recommend the 3D. I have use it a hand full of times and that's it. The glasses have dust on them from lack of use. I recommend this tv but without 3D.

Reviews.Title: My first LED TV
Reviews.Author: Ripu Daman Singh
Reviews.Content: After 7 months of use i thought it's time for me to share a few things about this TV. I did a lot of research and Amazon probably had cheapest price when i bought it. I was very skeptical about letting anyone handle my TV but now i am fan of Amazon service. TV was delivered in excellent condition and on time. LED TVs have the best picture quality and this TV delivers. There is nothing which beats this TVs quality (at price ~1000) when watching movies and TV shows. Looks sharp!!! Apps are very important for a companies success in modern era, to name a few this TV has HBO, Netlix and HULU Plus but this is where i am a bit disappointed they have some basic apps missing - HULU and AmazonPrime.Some disappointing news for sports lovers - SPORTS channel are not that great (nowhere close to movie quality). The bottom area which shows news on ESPN lacks quality (flickers and not that clear). When the camera is zoomed out and players are moving picture quality is not that great for my expectation but once camera zooms in and doesn't cover all the payers its good. I think its all because this TV is 120 Hz.Color quality is great but i noticed a few dots specially on black color (just a few), again it's a byproduct of LED TVs. One weird thing which could just be with my TV, after a few hours of Netlix (6-7 hrs on a lazy Sunday) TV automatically restarts. I haven't seen it ever happen when i not using apps i.e. watching cable. It seems to me more like a software problem rather than hardware problem. It is just like as if by mistake you restarted your computer.More or less LED is still growing technology and overall i would recommend this one if some is looking for LED in less than $1K. Happy shopping!!!!

Reviews.Title: Initial Disappointment
Reviews.Author: Edanba
Reviews.Content: The TV (along with its great picture) died after approximately two months of ownership.  I learned that flat panel TV failure typically involves the replacement of the mother board, or the screen (flat panel)itself. In my case, it was determined that the panel had to be replaced.  Outside of Amazon's replacement window, I defaulted to Samsung's warranty service for repair.  Under warranty, it took Samsung approximately three weeks to diagnose problem, receive part, and send out a service technician to do the on-site installation. Since the initial frustration associated with buying a new but defective TV, and the hoops you have to jump through to get service, diagnosis, and repair, the TV has been working fine.

Reviews.Title: contact me
Reviews.Author: Paez L
Reviews.Content: The 3d glasses was not in the box and in the list of items indicate that it is supposed to be together with the TV mapex-intl@hotmail.c

Reviews.Title: amazing picture
Reviews.Author: SkyPro
Reviews.Content: I owned two Samsung TV, this is my 3rd one.I love the picture quality, it even betterthan the LED 60' TV I bought 2 years ago.Completely satisfied with the product purchased.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV once you fix the settings
Reviews.Author: Kurzy Surfer
Reviews.Content: This TV has a beautiful picture, but only after you fix all the factory settings.  When I first turned it on, it had a rather muddy looking picture and watching it actually made me dizzy due to the auto motion settings.  Several other reviewers recommended settings that were very helpful.  I started from those and adjusted to my preferences and now I am very, very happy with this TV. Picture is amazing, sound is pretty darn good and I love the thin bezel.

Reviews.Title: Nice full featured TV at a nice price.
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Nice full featured TV that fit our requirements at a nice price. Received the TV within 2 days even with the free shipping option. Setup very fast, updated firmware, calibrated with some settings found off a TV forum and the TV looks great. Hooked up to our network directly through our router and the ability to stream movies/music/Netflix is great. Haven't tried out the various apps but it's nice to have them there if and when we do. Solid TV that fits our needs perfect. Will update review as needed once we've spent more time with it.I also have to commend Amazon for their customer service on this order. I initially ordered the wrong TV and the process in which we returned the TV, got the right set and dealing with refunds was a breeze.  I had to call them on 3 separate occasions and each time the representative was courteous/professional. The price of the TV was dropped nearly $70 in the time since we ordered and since I received and Amazon easily refunded the purchase price with no hassle. In the 10+ years I've shopped with Amazon, I've never had an issue with orders that I had to contact them directly. This was my first time and I was fully satisfied on all counts of having to deal with their customer service. Thank you Amazon for making things so simple for a satisfied and happy customer.

Reviews.Title: Simply Outstanding - UPDATED 10/22/12
Reviews.Author: Josh
Reviews.Content: UPDATE TIME - It's 10 months later and I couldn't be happier.  This TV turned out to be one of the best investments I have ever made.  I love it...This is an EXCELLENT television.  I am a bit of a tech head, though not crazy, and my primary objective is an excellent picture. This TV has an outstanding picture and the slim design is by far the nicest looking out there(nothing close in this price range).  I was incredibly impressed with the quality of the 3D.  My only constructive criticism is that it takes a bit to tweak the picture settings to get them perfect.  I have had the TV a week and find myself constantly playing around with the settings.  If you are in the market for a TV and you have done all of your research and want a "lux" looking and performing TV without paying upwards of $1500 this is hands down the TV to get.  I can't say enough about how pleased I am with it.I purchased the Interion large mount for $49 to go with it and it didn't come with the correct screws because of how slim the TV is.  I had to run out and grab the M8/25 screws at the hardware store.  no biggie.I also am using the Samsun battery operated glasses for the 2011 models.  They are also fantastic and about 1/4 of the price of the rechargeable glasses.

Reviews.Title: Very nice TV
Reviews.Author: Steve O
Reviews.Content: I like everything about this TV.  When we started watching 720p and 1080p media the first thing we notices was how ridiculously clear everything was.  Most shows were like looking through a window.  Everything is great.  However, I have a few issues with it.1. For some reason the sound won't go through the TV to the reciever in anything but Dolby Pro Logic II (I'm using Optical out and the signal is coming from an XBox 360 over HDMI).  I HATE ProLogic.  DTS is far superior.  I'm sure I'm missing a setting somewhere, but you would think it could default to the 'good' surround.  I may have to just go straight through from the XBox to the receiver over optical.  I dunno.2. The net apps, etc are useless.  I bought the 6400 for the small bezel size, but I technically also bought a "Smart TV".  My XBox, Roku box, and home computer serve video perfectly to the TV from Netflix, Youtube, Hulu+, etc in 1080p, however the TV's Netflix, Hulu, and other apps can't seem to even play in standard def.  The interface is super slow to boot, (bordering on unusable).  If this sort of thing is going to be included, it should work well enough to make it usable.3. Probably the least of my worries, but when playing most 360 games there is a portion of the screen in the lower corners that seems to display just off.  It might be the particular games I'm playing, though.Anyway, I'd give it five stars if it weren't for the Smart apps being so useless.  I haven't tried out any 3D yet, but again, I bought this model specifically for the smaller bezel.  I've never liked the 3D experience.

Reviews.Title: Samsung
Reviews.Author: bevs
Reviews.Content: Great TV.  Good 3D and love the size. Fits the room well and am impressed with the quality.  Clear picture.  Love it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Gloria Dapolito
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV a month ago and I am still in awe at the quality of the picture.  When I purchased it, my intention was just to use it to watch some 3D movies; but is has become our primary TV because of the fantastic picture and other features.  It is connected to a high quality surround system that provides a wonderful theater experience,  and a HD smart blu-ray, that brings smart TV features like FaceBook, YouTube and other social net works to another level.  It is awesome viewing "friends" photos from FaceBook on this large 55 inch HD TV, and browsing YouTube and watching videos is fantastic, you have to see it to believe it, it is just that great of a TV experience.  I was questioning myself for spending so much for a TV I was only going to use every now and than, as it turned out, it was one of my better purchases.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Piece of Technology
Reviews.Author: Abeszta
Reviews.Content: Purchased this TV after I returned the Sharp Aquos 830 52" and noticed a HUGE difference.  Picture quality is amazing, style is great, and the Samsung Apps seem reasonable.  I haven't used the 3D option and never really planned on using it.  Just wanted a decent TV, and 3D happened to be included.  The only complaint I have is with the PIP function.  It only allows the cable or over-the-air connections as the other PIP input.  This means I cannot connect my computer and watch my HD cable box at the same time without rigging up my connections through different cables.  Also, I hooked up a Polk Audio soundbar at the same time so I never really got to hear the speakers, but from what I understand they are pretty weak.  Soundbar sounds great though!! Since that is my biggest complaint, I am extremely happy overall and wouldn't have selected any other TV.

Reviews.Title: GREAT!!!
Reviews.Author: Shirley
Reviews.Content: Upgrading from a 46 inch Samsung to this was a snap. Main concern I had was not tv quality since Samsung is outstanding it was will this tv fit my wife's New entertainment center's tv spot. The measurements given in the product review where perfect. Delivery man carried it in and opened then plugged in to make certain all was well. Then I placed it in the new furniture and WOW it fit. And yes 3-D is impressive. Fast delivery also.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LED Tv. 3D
Reviews.Author: brutus
Reviews.Content: The Tv. Arrived when it was supposed to. Setup was very easy. The picture quality was as good as I thought it should be. I hooked up a Bose surround sound to it so I do not know true quality of Tv. sound . On some HD. tv shows the picture almost looks 3D.I have not played a 3D movie yet so I can not rate that aspect.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!  One little issue
Reviews.Author: GolfGryl
Reviews.Content: This TV is GREAT!  Picture quality is absolutely AMAZING. My PS3 connected to the TV is addictive. I am like a little kid with a major new toy. The only problem I have is trying to figure out why my display says 60hz on the TV - not 120hz as advertised on Amazon.  Still trying to figure that out.  If I did not already have the PS3, I would have purchased the 6500 with the integrate web browser.  I can always purchse the dongle later.  Amazon delivery was fast as usual.  I am a Prime member so received the TV in one day.  My other items orders arrived in two days.  Amazon I love your service.

Reviews.Title: Awesome buy!
Reviews.Author: Shyam
Reviews.Content: I think this is the best product that I have bought, and that too at the perfect price. Its got all the features a latest TV should have.There is just one negative, on connecting external speakers to the TV, you cannot adjust its volume using the TV remote, which can be done in other models. But I am sure there will be some workaround for this problem, and its hardly any problem.I simply love this TV. Proud to own it!

Reviews.Title: Samsung Television
Reviews.Author: M.M.Loris
Reviews.Content: We are very happy with our purchase.  We received the item in the time promised.  The picture on this television is incredible!  I would purchase from this vendor again and would recommend this vendor to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: disappointing
Reviews.Author: raybee "raybee98"
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed in the picture quality of this tv. Images jump and stick when scene changes and there is a visible drag quality to movement. If the scene is still the picture is great though, but who needs that? A very expensive pciture viewer. Should have gone with a Sony. Going to try to return this. What a pain.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for the money
Reviews.Author: hsirahrian
Reviews.Content: Excellent TV for the price !! No frame makes the TV very elegant to look at.Great for watching movies and 3D content.2D-3D feature is also very impressive. Calibration helps in eliminating LED bleed completely. Samsung has improved their sound quality from previous models.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the money
Reviews.Author: Nick T "Nick"
Reviews.Content: I recently received this TV and I am very impressed with it. The picture is excellent and the design of the set itself is just remarkable. It's extremely thin and light (so much so that I easily mounted it to the wall by myself). The menu structure has been redone as compared to older Samsung TVs and is very intuitive and easy to use. My one gripe, and reason for 4 stars instead of 5, is that this TV does not have built-in wifi, and to get that you need to order a dongle from Samsung. I think that's a bit cheap, but oh well.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture
Reviews.Author: Nancy Hemmerich
Reviews.Content: Amazon's price was $100 less than other vendors.  Delivery was as stated and the delivery staff (both office and actual delivery men were very courteous.  I haven't figured out how to use all its features but the picture is very clear and the color is balanced perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Best Picture So Far
Reviews.Author: Walter L. Martinez
Reviews.Content: This is my second HD TV, the first being a 32" Panasonic.  In a nutshell, this is the finest TV I have seen anywhere.  After having this TV for a little over a month, nothing else comes close in picture clarity and color. The program material I have been viewing is broadcast which is very clear for all the big networks with my setup.  This model is ultra modern with the thin bezel. I am glad that I went with this new sleek design. I am a very happy with this purchase and recommend this Samsung model.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic picture...super thin profile
Reviews.Author: J. D "JD"
Reviews.Content: I am ABSOLUTELY loving this super-thin, super-bright LED-backlit 55-inch HDTV set! I bought this to replace an older Samsung LN52A650 52-Inch 1080p set that was mounted on the wall of a room we called "the man cave". I sold that house and needed a replacement set. Samsung was once again my first choice.I could not be happier with the UN55D6400 model...the crystal-clear quality of the HD video is AMAZING. This set is primarily tasked with XBox 360 gaming for my teenagers, and it looks superb from any viewing angle.Like many others, I spent hours and hours researching these sets before pulling the trigger. Based on the quality of my previous Samsung HDTV, I felt confident in the Samsung brand. At the time I made the LN52A650 purchase in 2008, that particular model was ranked #1 by Consumer Reports for 50-inch+ sets. I'm VERY glad that I made the decision to buy another Samsung set...I'm equally happy with this UN55D6400 set. I love it so much I'm considering buying another one!I definitely HIGHLY recommend this set. Go for it! You'll be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: Awesome T.V.
Reviews.Author: Bryant
Reviews.Content: No complaints! AWESOME T.V. One of my favorite things is it can play .MKV files off of a USB drive.

Reviews.Title: great TV
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: for the price this is a great tv. i originally purchased an LG tv but then quickly returned it because i was not happy with the quality.  the 3D is good for the most part. i can occasionally see some ghosting but nothing like other people have reported.  it seems like they could add more adjustment functionality in the future through internet updates.  overall i was extremely happy with the picture quality. the blacks are so incredibly black and the colors are so vivid.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN40D6400 40-Inch 1080p 120 Hz 3D LED HDTV...yes, it's that good
Reviews.Author: Thomas P. Huggins
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this TV over all other brands (besides maybe LG), especially if you want a 40". I spent a while researching this and even went into several stores to see and compare the TVs in-person (which you should ALWAYS do if you're buying a TV!). One of the complaints I heard about his TV is the back-lighting bleeding through the screen and it's most apparent when there is a darker scene. This is true, but don't let it deter you. You may be able to see it, but it is hardly noticeable.I haven't used the 3D capability yet because I don't have the glasses BUT what I can tell you is that I have seen this model next to the D6300 model (doesn't have 3D capability) and you CAN tell a difference in picture quality. You probably couldn't tell the difference if they weren't side-by-side, but after seeing the clarity difference between the two I thought that if I was going to spend around $1000 on a TV I might as well get one of the best ones on the market so I don't have to buy an new one again for a while.I RECOMMEND THIS TVAs a side note, considering the high quality of these products I also got a Samsung blu-ray player (Samsung BD-D6500 3D Blu-ray Disc Player). It's great how compatible the TV and blu-ray player are, though I'm sure other blu-ray players work great too; however, I wanted a seamless experience between my products and that's what I got!

Reviews.Title: Miserable Experience, lousy service
Reviews.Author: Robert T Marcom
Reviews.Content: We've owned this TV for about 8 months and it has never worked correctly.  It has so many bugs, I don't have time to list them all, and if it was possible to give zero stars, I would do so.  The first TV was replaced by Samsung and the replacement soon developed an inability to find attached devices (the satellite DVR and a Sony Blu-Ray player). Next, it began starting up with a washed-out picture in green tint.  then, we started getting a myriad of nonsense error messages.  We did everything that Samsung service recommended and it only got worse.  We're now in discussion with them demanding a refund.  This thing is a lemon. We replaced it with a Sony Bravia and it has worked perfectly so far.

Reviews.Title: So much potential
Reviews.Author: NickisratingstuffonAmazon
Reviews.Content: After less than 2 days of putting this set through its paces, I ended up sending it back. Very promising TV after reading professional and user reviews, but an odd video issue and lackluster Samsung support had me return it.The quality of the video overall is fantastic. Crisp and clear, and the 3D content I tried with it (a couple PS3 games and a Blu-ray movie) were better than I anticipated.The problem that arose for me was every 20-60 seconds or so, there was video lag where the entire image would stop momentarily and then run as normal. It appears to be some sort of processing issue where the set would hang, reset the video. Went though the settings making sure all the enhancements were off, tried with all on, limited one by one to try to find what the culprit could be. I was able to replicate on the 3 different HDMI inputs. Made sure software was updated. Contacted support, but no solution was found.I wanted this to be my next big stupid purchase, but I ended up with a bum TV. I would have ordered a replacement, but spending the money on shipping back to Amazon had me in the hole and would be even worse off if I got another one with the same issue.

Reviews.Title: A huge letdown from Samsung...

I would get something else if I had more time to waste, but unfortunately I do not.Either a lot of people got really lucky with their units or they don't know any better.Mind you, I have loved all my past Samsung TV's but they really messed this one up.This is the most expensive piece of garbage I have ever purchased.On the plus side it looks very nice on the wall "When it's turned off"...

Reviews.Title: SAMSUNG HD 3D TV (  Stupidly without 3D glasses to view with)!!!

Very slim and very lightweight.Quite slow to bring a picture to the screen after initial turn on but then it gives you everything you need for today's TV viewing.Including very  high volume control, which is better than most for such a slimline tv. I can't comment on the 3D capability as the glasses didn't come with the set which I find quite strange. The glasses as an extra cost seems to defeat the whole point of purchasing a 3D option. Why do manufacturers do that? Wouldn't you think " this is a 3D tv but you cannot watch this feature unless you shell out some more bucks to buy an integral part of it's features" VERY WEIRDA good buy and value for money.Except for the very negative missing 3D glasses.

Reviews.Title: Poor Tuner, Additional burdens on Consumer
Reviews.Author: KingD
Reviews.Content: The onboard tuner for this unit is horrible! The only channels that come in clearly are HD channels. Basic analog CATV are the worst; representing bad washed out watercolors. DTV channels are also poor quality; they remind me of trying to maximize a window on the web where they attempt to magnify an image intended for an 8 inch screen, grainy with a heavy dose of tracing. Spending 30 minutes going through the motions with Monique (Costco Concierge) and Jamie (Samsung) left me with me with the impression that Samsung was aware that their tuner was sub par (although Jamie would not admit to it) she just suggested that I purchase a component with a HDMI output. I was left with the feeling of getting the run-a-round; Jamie suggested that I had poor quality coax, not so, I have quad shield RG6, and my 36" CRT Sony had a crystal clear picture off the very same cable. I am very disappointed; I was planning on watching more than DVDs and 4 HD channels on this not-so-inexpensive piece pf equipment.It is also disappointing that this not-so-inexpensive television is not integrated with WiFi, it is WiFi capable, however, you must search out and purchase a proprietary Samsung dongle ($80) and it will also cost you one of your USB ports.Please consider including two sets of four bolts to accommodate 98% of wall mount brackets. My wall mount kit included hardware however; they are too long or too short as this unit has created an irregular situation in that their screw receivers are recessed by approximately 5/16" (8mm) in addition to the screw stops - which I understand prevent damage to the unit. However, I must now run out and purchase hardware of the proper length and thread and hope that is not of a dissimilar metal.Incidentally, the picture from my blue-ray DVD really is beautiful-if that is all you plan on using it for.
